image.altText: An older couple stands outside their suburban home and smiles.

props.synopsis: Transport Minister Chris Steel has written to the toll operator asking it to provide refunds to affected ACT motorists who were issued with toll notices for trips they did not take, due to similarities between licence plates.

title.children: Canberra drivers wrongly charged for trips on Sydney toll roads

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Hermes handbags, multiple properties, cash and a Rolex watch receipt for $24,000, are alleged to be part of the "unexplained wealth" of a Chinese national charged with reckless foreign interference in Canberra last week.

title.children: Court hears woman charged with foreign interference has 'unexplained wealth'

image.altText: A long, thin indoor pool with a ramp into the water.

props.synopsis: After a five-year wait, a new hydrotherapy pool is ready to open in Canberra's south, and while it's being welcomed by those living with chronic health conditions, concerns remain that it won't be enough to meet demand.

title.children: 'A long day coming': New hydrotherapy pool set to open in Tuggeranong

image.altText: Members of an orchestra on stage.

props.synopsis: The Australian Chamber Orchestra's Richard Tognetti has warned that the ANU's plan to axe its School of Music would result in an "act of cultural vandalism", with another Canberra ensemble saying its offer to help has been rejected.

title.children: Australian Chamber Orchestra slams ANU plan as 'cultural vandalism'

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair and glasses stands outdoors looking serious.

props.synopsis: After being diagnosed with Hodgkin lymphoma, Felicity Tait was left in a difficult financial position amid unexpected cancer-related expenses.

title.children: Felicity was overseas when the rapid weight loss and night sweats started

image.altText: Kristian White in suit

props.synopsis: Former NSW police officer Kristian White, who avoided a jail sentence for fatally tasering a 95-year-old woman, drops a bid to have his removal from the force reviewed.

title.children: Ex-cop who tasered 95yo Clare Nowland withdraws from bid to get job back

image.altText: Robert F Kennedy Kr in a black suit and tie sitting at a table while speaking and gesturing with his hands

props.synopsis: Under the watch of Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr, a vaccine-preventable disease has continued to spread across the United States.

title.children: US on the brink of major public health failure

image.altText: Kathleen Folbigg gives an interview to NBN

props.synopsis: Speaking out for the first time after the NSW government's payout offer, Kathleen Folbigg says the lack of transparency around how the sum was calculated has left her feeling "confused" and "shocked".

title.children: 'A slap in the face': Kathleen Folbigg speaks out against $2m payout

image.altText: A husband and wife walking towards court, with lawyers standing either side of them.

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury has heard the helicopter pilot involved in a fatal 2022 crash — killing Matt Wright's Netflix co-star — had a reputation as "a party animal" and had been a frequent drug user.

title.children: Pilot disconnected flight meter to cover 'fishing, partying', Supreme Court hears

image.altText: Still from video of near miss between train and ute at Tasmanian rail crossing.

props.synopsis: The latest compilation video of near misses is released, as part of a plea to Tasmanian drivers and pedestrians to do better at rail crossings — with the grim warning that trains "do not apologise".

title.children: Trains 'do not apologise': Videos of close calls released in plea for safety

image.altText: Nat Fyfe

props.synopsis: Dual Brownlow medallist Nat Fyfe has confirmed he will retire at the end of the 2025 AFL season.

title.children: 'I don't need anything further': Nat Fyfe to retire at end of AFL season

image.altText: The Nadesalingam family pose for the photo.

props.synopsis: Checking in with the Tamil family from the small town of Biloela who were at the centre of one of the country's biggest people-power movements of recent years.

title.children: Biloela family isn't taking its ordinary Australian life for granted

image.altText: a baby boy looking into the camera, a towel loosely covering the top of his head and back

props.synopsis: Family day care makes up just 5 per cent of Australia's early childhood education and care system, but insiders, experts and regulatory documents paint a picture of a sector beset by troubling incidents and structural risk.

title.children: Parents of boy who died in family day care urge authorities to 'wake up'

image.altText: A young woman is pushed in the back of the head by a man in front of a large mob of people.

props.synopsis: A video showing a young woman being jeered at and assaulted by a large group of men as she walks across a university campus in Papua New Guinea is condemned by the university's vice-chancellor and women's rights activists.

title.children: Video of young woman mobbed at PNG university sparks outrage

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: When Catherine Ridley was bitten in her blanket by a highly venomous snake in a remote West Australian desert community it began a frantic dash of more than 70 kilometres to reach medical help.

title.children: Woman faces 'worst nightmare' bitten by an outback king brown

image.altText: A serious-looking man wearing a helmet and flak-jacket with "PRESS" printed on it, holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: Al Jazeera says a group of its correspondents and camera crew have been killed in an Israeli strike on their tent in Gaza City.

title.children: Israel kills Al Jazeera journalists in Gaza air strike

image.altText: A man with a beard wearing sunglasses takes a selfie

props.synopsis: A woman has told a court how she "watched helplessly" as her partner was set on fire and murdered by his housemate in Adelaide's west more than four years ago. Warning: This story contains content which some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Murder victim set alight in 'act of extreme cruelty', partner tells court

image.altText: A black and white photo of a horse behind a gate in a paddock with a shooting star in the top left hand corner of the shot.

props.synopsis: The meteor was seen across Victoria just after 7:30pm on Sunday, with some observers describing a large, bright object and a loud boom.

title.children: 'Thought it was a plane crash': Meteor shakes houses across Victoria

image.altText: A narrow river runs through the centre of the image, on either side is a thick blanket of river red gum trees.

props.synopsis: Irrigators from New South Wales and Victoria allege the Murray-Darling Basin Authority mismanaged water between 2017 and 2019, costing them more than $1 billion in losses.

title.children: Class action alleges water authority cost 28,000 irrigators millions

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks at a lecturn.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says he will evict homeless people from the US capital and jail criminals despite Washington's mayor arguing there is no current spike in crime.

title.children: Trump vows to evict homeless from Washington DC

image.altText: A woman, looking on, with art visible on a wall behind her.

props.synopsis: Russia's relentless drone and missile attacks on Ukraine mean the arrival of long-awaited US-made Patriot air defence systems cannot come soon enough.

title.children: 'War of technology' given boost as Patriot air defences head to Ukraine

image.altText: Sign saying 'welcome to Charleville'

props.synopsis: Murweh Shire Council, in south-west Queensland, is investigating after testing found a rare amoeba that can cause a serious brain infection in its water supply.

title.children: Potentially deadly brain-eating amoeba found in Qld shire's drinking water

image.altText: Current treasurer Jim Chalmers (left) and former treasurer Paul Keating (right).

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers must find a way to repeat what Paul Keating did in the 1980s and 90s, and lift productivity. Good luck with that.

title.children: Amid Trump's tariffs, Chalmers must repeat what Keating did in the 80s

image.altText: A group of people look onto a pile of rubble, a man in high vis stands among the debris.

props.synopsis: An earthquake, with its epicentre in the town of Sindirgi, sends shocks that were felt 200 kilometres to the north in Istanbul — a city of more than 16 million people.

title.children: Deadly Türkiye earthquake destroys more than a dozen buildings

image.altText: A large pile of used tyres dumped on a walking track among bushland.

props.synopsis: More than 550 used car tyres have been left in a Gold Coast national park in 48 hours, in an "extremely serious" case of illegal dumping.

title.children: Motorists likely to pay twice for illegally dumped tyres

image.altText: A man with short grey hair wearing a vest and wetsuit.

props.synopsis: A tourism survey finds about 40 per cent of South Australian businesses impacted by the toxic algal bloom have experienced a downturn in trade as the government's financial support is starting to flow to those affected.

title.children: Algal bloom and 'negative perceptions' affecting SA tourism, survey finds

image.altText: An aerial shot of the University of Western Australia's Crawley campus.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's major universities has suffered a data breach that exposed the password information of thousands of staff and students.

title.children: University of Western Australia suffers major data breach

image.altText: Surgeons work on a patient in a hospital surgery.

props.synopsis: Whistleblower doctors who revealed surgeries were being delayed at Orange Hospital have a breakthrough, with local health bosses promising to look into the feasibility of robotic surgery.

title.children: Breakthrough for whistleblower doctors at major NSW hospital

image.altText: A black and white photo of London, which looks grainy due to fog

props.synopsis: The Great Smog of London spurred the British to fight for better air quality in the 1950s. As concerns about air pollution surface in Australia, some say the incident still holds lessons.

title.children: 'I couldn't believe the air quality': From London's Great Smog to Launceston

image.altText: Green imitation handgun on a brown paper.

props.synopsis: A University of Wollongong student allegedly found with 3D-printed guns in his dorm room has been granted conditional bail.

title.children: Teen granted bail after 3D-printed firearms found on uni campus

image.altText: A selfie of a woman with dyed maroon coloured hair

props.synopsis: An English backpacker who hit and killed a man while riding an e-scooter in Perth’s CBD has admitted dangerous driving and drink driving causing death.

title.children: UK backpacker admits drink driving on e-scooter, killing Perth father

image.altText: Masked men holding machine guns in the back of a military ute.

props.synopsis: A video of Syrian government forces killing a volunteer medic in a hospital has emerged following clashes between local Druze fighters and Bedouin tribes.

title.children: Syrian government forces kill volunteer medic in hospital

image.altText: Gabrielle Morrissey

props.synopsis: Gabrielle Morrissey, former CEO of Women and Children First, reached a confidential settlement with the domestic violence charity after it accused her of misappropriating $150,000 for her own benefit.

title.children: Former CEO agrees to pay back $150k to charity she's accused of defrauding

image.altText: ,Bel Foster standing on a bare brown escarpment

props.synopsis: The disappearance of beloved trees from Perth's Kings Park leaves a scar across the escarpment and makes it vulnerable to landslides, but provides a chance to future-proof the area amid a drying climate.

title.children: Removal of trees infested with shot-hole borer has surprising outcomes
